SAT Preparation Guide

About the SAT

The SAT is a standardized test widely used for college admissions in the USA. It assesses your readiness for college with sections on Evidence-Based Reading, Writing, Math, and an optional Essay. A strong SAT score can enhance your college application.

Tips for SAT Preparation

  • Understand the Format: Familiarize yourself with the test sections and types of questions.
  • Create a Study Plan: Allocate time each week to focus on different sections of the SAT.
  • Practice Regularly: Use official practice tests to simulate the test environment.
  • Focus on Weak Areas: Spend extra time improving sections where you score lower.
  • Learn Time Management: Practice completing sections within the allotted time.
  • Review Your Mistakes: Analyze errors in practice tests and learn from them.
